trans-unit.source: An abstract class that provides a base for all inline flow content elements.
Initializes base class values when called by a derived class.
Gets or sets the baseline alignment for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
A member or the <xref href="System.Windows.BaselineAlignment"></xref> enumeration specifying the baseline alignment for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.BaselineAlignment"></xref>.**Baseline**.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline.BaselineAlignment"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the relative direction for flow of content within a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element.
The flow direction of content typically corresponds to the innate flow direction of the language being represented.
Hebrew and Arabic provide examples of languages that naturally flow from right-to-left.
English, German, and Russian provide examples of languages that naturally flow from left-to-right.
**Note:** The value of this property is not automatically changed to match the language used by the operating system.
If you need to use a different value then the default of <xref:System.Windows.FlowDirection.LeftToRight>, you must specify it yourself.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsParentArrange%2A>
A member of the <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection"></xref> enumeration specifying the relative flow direction.
Getting this property returns the currently effective flow direction.
Setting this property causes the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element to re-flow in the indicated direction.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.FlowDirection.LeftToRight"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline.FlowDirection"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the next <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element that is a peer to this element.

An <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object representing the next <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element that is a peer to this element, or **null** if there is no next <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element.
This property has no default value.
Gets the previous <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element that is a peer to this element.

An <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object representing the previous <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element that is a peer to this element, or **null** if there is no previous <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> element.
This property has no default value.
Gets an <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> elements that are siblings (peers) to this element.
The collection returned by this property always contains the element through which the collection is requested.
That is, an inline element is considered to be its own sibling for the purpose of building a collection of siblings for the element.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection"></xref> object that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> elements that are siblings to this element.
This property has no default value.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection"></xref> that contains text decorations to apply to this element.
A <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration> object is a visual ornamentation you can add to text.
There are four types of text decorations: underline, baseline, strikethrough, and overline.
For more information about text decorations, see [How to: Create a Text Decoration](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/how-to-create-a-text-decoration.md).
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
A <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection"></xref> collection that contains text decorations to apply to this element.
The default value is **null** (no text decorations applied).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline.TextDecorations"></xref> dependency property.
